track.name: Just Friends
comments: great sax, hideous strings and blather......  the worst of Parker's recordings
The brilliant saxophonist who became at the origins of modern jazz.
Actually problem solved. I zoomed in 500x on google chrome so now the entire screen is a really pixelated slideshow.

OOOOOOOOOOOooooooooooo You are a proper Charlie! I like you so much.
I would love to be your friend.
dreadful strings arrangement shown up by the lyrical sublimely played Charlie who is on song as a bird branching out by himself as usual. Piano is fine but those violins.........

as a string musician who loves jazz, why oh WHY are there no jazz projects involving even halfway decent arrangers for strings? I literally think I could do better than this given time and a wage. Parker, of course, is regardlessly sublime ...
Love these old crap recordings -it's the only way to listen to jazz.
Hmmmmmm......looking southward I notice that powerful drugs are in abundance around the globe! Anyhow, Charlie is great!

Thanks for all the Shout's you guy's. I guess I didn't realize how much the community gets involved. I usually just start my station, play a little solitaire and sleep to the music all night. I've been researching songs to learn the various styles and melodies each artist creates, so I can sing and play them.
